Class Player

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.player.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IPlayer
public class Player extends Object implements IPlayer, Serializable
Represents a player in the Uno game.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String typePlayer)
      Constructs a Player object with a specified player type. Initializes the player's hand of cards, sets the player type, and creates a new instance of CardChecker for card validation.
      Parameters:
      typePlayer - the type of the player (e.g., "Human" or "Machine")

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      public void addCard(Card card)
      Adds a card to the player's hand.
      Specified by:
      addCard in interface IPlayer
      Parameters:
      card - the card to be added

    • getCardsPlayer

      public ArrayList<Card> getCardsPlayer()
      Returns a copy of the player's hand of cards. This method returns a new list to preserve encapsulation and prevent external modifications to the original hand.
      Specified by:
      getCardsPlayer in interface IPlayer
      Returns:
      a copy of the list of cards in the player's hand

    • removeCard

      public void removeCard(int index)
      Removes a card from the player's hand at the specified index. If the index is invalid, no action is taken.
      Specified by:
      removeCard in interface IPlayer
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the card to be removed

    • getCard

      public Card getCard(int index)
      Retrieves the card at the specified index from the player's hand. If the index is out of bounds, returns null.
      Specified by:
      getCard in interface IPlayer
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the card to retrieve
      Returns:
      the card at the specified index, or null if the index is invalid

    • getTypePlayer

      public String getTypePlayer()
      Returns the type of the player.
      Returns:
      the player type (e.g., "Human" or "Machine")

    • hasPlayableCard

      public boolean hasPlayableCard(Card topCard)
      Checks if the player has at least one card that can be played over the given top card.
      Parameters:
      topCard - the top card on the discard pile
      Returns:
      true if the player has a playable card, false otherwise

    • getCardCount

      public int getCardCount()
      Returns the number of cards in the player's hand.
      Returns:
      the total count of cards the player currently holds

    • getPlayerName

      public String getPlayerName()
      Returns the player's name.
      Returns:
      the player name.

    • setPlayerName

      public void setPlayerName(String playerName)
      Configure the player's name.
